newsitem.title: USA: Deutsche Telekom competitors to have access.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche Telekom competitors to have access.

text.p: Deutsche Telekom Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Dr. Ron Sommer, on Thursday said the company will guarantee all competitors access to its networks in time for January 1, 1998.

Sommer, in a speech before representatives of the United States government and private industry, as well as members of the media, said the company is currently taking "all necessary steps to this effect."
After January 1, 1998, Germany "will have one of the most liberalized, and thus, certainly one of the most intensely competitive telecommunications markets in the world," Sommer said.
"One central aspect of turning liberalization into concrete reality in every telecommunications market is the administration of network access agreements," he added.

Sommer contrasted this situation to that in the United States. where, he said, "...there still will be restrictions on access to the market for foreign companies, even after implementation of the WTO agreement effective at the beginning of 1998".
The question of how the agreement will be implemented in the U.S. is also still open, Sommer said.
Deutsche Telekom AG is Europe's largest telecommunications company and the third largest carrier worldwide.
